page.title: 04Wytham, a country village.
page.content: Wytham village nestles at the foot of Wytham hill. Bounded by water meadows and backed by woodland, the village is very rural. The small stone cottages are thatched or tiled. Old farms have been divided up to house families but everywhere the original style of building has been preserved. At the centre of the village is the pub,next to the War Memorial and facing the Post Office and the village store. Up the hill are the church and Wytham Abbey, not connected, but adjacent. Stone walls surround many of the buildings, but soon give way to hedges A single road goes through the village linking it in one direction with Wolvercote and in the other with the A34, bypassing Oxford to the west. Tiny hump-backed stone bridges take the road over the river. Truly, 'a village in a bend'.
